canvases.label: Gaelic Liturgy

metadata.value: John Knox's Liturgy, or The Book of Common Order, is a directory for public worship in the Reformed Church of Scotland. Originally published in Geneva, the prayer-book was introduced into Scotland and was circulated for general use in the administration of the sacraments and solemnization of marriages and burials of the dead. Knox and the Scottish Reformers wanted to bring the Gaelic-speaking inhabitants of the Highlands under the same christianizing influences as the rest of the land, and the book was accordingly translated into Gaelic by John Carswell (ca. 1520-1572) and published in 1567.
